ref: 3175 kiri ʻ scattering, heap ʼ in ākhu -- kirí -- m. ʻ molehill ʼ MaitrS., kiriká -- ʻ sparkling ʼ VS. &rcirclemacr Dm. kīr ʻ snow ʼ, Kal. kīˊrik, Phal. kĭ̄r m. (semant. cf. Av. vafra -- ~ Sk. vap -- , Welsh eira < pargyo -- ~ Lat. spargere); S. kiri f. ʻ ashes ʼ; P. kirak f. ʻ dust or sand mixed in bread or flour ʼ; -- in cmpd.: N. kir -- kaũlā ʻ small bits of rice grains ʼ; H. kir -- kiṭī f. ʻ dust ʼ; M. kirkiṭṇẽ ʻ to have dough or rice adhere to the hands ʼ, kir -- kisā m. ʻ dust in worm -- eaten wood ʼ.
